title: 'I never get tired of saying Roll Tide!' Avery Johnson celebrates homecoming at Alabama pep rally
text:

Avery Johnson celebrates homecoming at Alabama pep rally Avery Johnson speaks to fans at Alabama homecoming pep rally Alabama basketball head coach Avery Johnson speaks to Crimson Tide fans at the annual homecoming pep rally on the Quad in Tuscaloosa on Friday, Oct. 9, 2015. (Ben Flanagan/AL.com) Comments 
TUSCALOOSA, Alabama -- "Buckle up," homecoming pep rally emcee Eli Gold said to the crowd moments before announcing the evening's next speaker. 
That could only mean Alabama's new basketball head coach Avery Johnson would take the stage. Gold also told the crowd to help the "shy" Johnson through the speech, but fans familiar with Johnson's big personality laughed it off. 
Hoarse after coaching his seventh practice with the Tide hoops team, Johnson thanked the fans for their support during his tenure so far and took a moment to introduce his wife and family "head coach" to the crowd. 
"I have to introduce the head coach of the Johnson family, so you all can see how pretty she is," Johnson said before asking his wife Cassandra to stand for recognition.
